docs.snippet: The title of the Oscar-nominated movie is a quasi-military term that gives a sense of just how much damage a bomb can have....
docs.lead_paragraph: If intellectuals had a say in the Oscar race, "The Hurt Locker" would surely win, judging from the crowd that turned up at a party at the Monkey Bar celebrating the publication of the movie's shooting script on Tuesday night. Not to say that Academy members aren't intellectuals; they're just not public about it. Or -- O.K., we're getting out of this before we start a Hollywood elite versus New York elite flame war. (It would be fought entirely with donations to eco-charities.)
docs.abstract: The title of the Oscar-nominated movie is a quasi-military term that gives a sense of just how much damage a bomb can have.

headline.main: What's in a Name, 'Hurt Locker' Edition

docs.snippet: If you missed the show at the Allen Room,  don't despair: you can listen to a world premiere by the composer David Longstreth, the band's guitarist and lead singer, tonight. His piece is one of four world premieres that will be presented by Bang o...
docs.lead_paragraph: If you missed the show at the Allen Room, don't despair: you can listen to a world premiere by the composer David Longstreth, the band's guitarist and lead singer, tonight. His piece is one of four world premieres that will be presented by Bang on a Can All-Stars at the 2010 People's Commissioning Fund Concert at Merkin Concert Hall. As part of the program, the chamber ensemble will also perform works by the Swiss ambient-funk-pianist-composer Nik Bärtsch, the British electro-acoustic composer Oscar Bettison and the Boston composer-inventor Christine Southworth. There will also be a recent work by Michael Nyman for a film by the photographer Paul Strand and a selection from the group's live arrangement of Brian Eno's "Music for Airports."

docs.snippet: A nomination for "Burma VJ" is big news in that repressed country, according to a Burmese monk who risked his life to cover an uprising....
docs.lead_paragraph: If ever you doubted the greater good of an Oscar nomination - if ever you thought this whole awards season stuff was just a bunch of razzle-dazzle designed to give people who already hold themselves in pretty high regard even more cause for self-congratulation, not to mention giving them more money, more glamorous stuff to wear, parties to attend and free stuff to paw through - then perhaps you should talk to a Burmese monk.
docs.abstract: A nomination for "Burma VJ" is big news in that repressed country, according to a Burmese monk who risked his life to cover an uprising.

docs.snippet: While some prognosticators are pushing "The Hurt Locker," the Motion Picture Sound Editors guild gave its Golden Reel Awards for sound editing, effects and music to "Avatar."...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Bagger's continued quest to help you win your Oscar pool, we present -- finely tuned drumroll, please -- a primer on the sound awards. (If you need a background of false information on the technical stuff, watch this video about foley artists.) The nominees this year for sound editing and sound mixing are "Avatar," "The Hurt Locker," "Inglourious Basterds" and "Star Trek" for both categories; "Up" rounds out the group for editing and "Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen" for mixing.
docs.abstract: While some prognosticators are pushing "The Hurt Locker," the Motion Picture Sound Editors guild gave its Golden Reel Awards for sound editing, effects and music to "Avatar."

docs.snippet: The Academy's reaching-out-to-the-youth campaign continues with snazzy party-planning tips on its Web site, including a downloadable card for Oscar bingo....
docs.lead_paragraph: When you think Oscars, you think "Bingo!," right? The Academy's reaching-out-to-the-youth campaign continues with snazzy party-planning tips on its Web site, including a downloadable card for Oscar bingo, with squares for "Crying," "Winner Accepts Oscar in a Foreign Language" and, mystifyingly, "Lauren Bacall." (Spoiler?!)
docs.abstract: The Academy's reaching-out-to-the-youth campaign continues with snazzy party-planning tips on its Web site, including a downloadable card for Oscar bingo.

headline.main: Tips to Jazz Up Your Oscar Party

docs.snippet: As the Tents folded on Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week for the very last time, the race was on for a new vision of pared-down American chic....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the Tents folded on Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week for the very last time, the race was on for a new vision of pared-down American chic. With Calvin, Isaac, Ralph, Michael and Tommy all in a heat, who came out ahead? As Scorecard can tell you, Calvin Klein's women's-wear designer Francisco Costa took his minimalist vision to the max, yet it was Michael Kors who took the gold for his streamlined yet sensual sportswear. See you at Lincoln Center -- and London!
docs.abstract: As the Tents folded on Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week for the very last time, the race was on for a new vision of pared-down American chic.
